title: Learn about the Subtleties of Numbers and Time in Arabic
headline: Fathom the essentials of the Arabic numeric system to enrich your Egyptian proficiency with this free online course.
description: Imagine that mastering Arabic can broaden your intellect and strengthen your confidence as you prepare to immerse yourself in Eastern culture, do business in the Arab world or ask the tour guide what time it is. This course will teach you all about the Arabic numeral system and how to tell the time to reply to the question: ‘E'sa3a kam elwa2ty?’. So sharpen your Arabic skills by enrolling now and become adept at conversing in this language.
courseDescription:
Mediterranean culture has advanced philosophical, intellectual and culinary achievements for human civilisation. Numerous individuals learn a second language in pursuing their dreams. What better way to discover the Middle East than to understand its primary language? Learning a foreign tongue demands awareness and respect for what you have mastered. This course aims to educate you on the necessary knowledge concerning the Arabic numbering system, conjugation norms, diction, morphology and linguistic principles required to bring out your educational endeavour. Even if you have no prior command of the language or are currently acquiring Arabic vocabulary, it is crucial to focus on your communication skills by connecting familiar terminology with the words and sentences that integrate you into the Arabic world. It is not required to devote many hours to literacy exercises or to spend every day studying grammatical rules to quickly achieve a level of proficiency. The training sessions will immerse you in casual Arabic conversations and the teaching approaches will aid your language development to help you feel like a local. The first segment of this course covers the fundamentals of the numerical system, from zero to one hundred. You will discover how to say your phone number, along with the Shamya nuances related to pronunciation and vocabulary. Then you will learn about common banknotes utilised across the Middle East like the dinar, which is the currency used in Algeria, Kuwait, Iraq, Tunis, Libya and Jordan.

Join the competition to master the language, stand out and become a suitable candidate for many jobs requiring Arabic. Once you contemplate the results of the time and energy you invested into grasping the Egyptian dialect, you will see that it is well worthwhile. Learn the vocabulary you'll need to communicate in Egyptian dialect while shopping, giving directions, or simply saying ‘Ana mashy e'sa3a wa7da b'elil’ to learn at your own pace. Keep in mind that native Arabic speakers are in high demand. A few of the markets available are data management, document translation, and interpreting. Financial services, education, culture, and media are some of the other fields. You will stand out if you learn Arabic, but mastering it will make you appear cultured and classy. Regardless of what you've heard, there are strategies for learning almost every foreign language. Learning Arabic normally requires about one and a half years of study. Mohamed Elshenawy will be your Egyptian instructor. In the module 'Mastering Linguistic Utterances in Arabic', he will help you comprehend the cultural richness of the Middle East during this stage of your Arabic journey by presenting the Arabic way to denote the time, as well as the subtleties between 25 minutes and 35 minutes. Then, you will refer to numbers, phrases and places in casual conversations to rehearse the specific wording for women and men. Furthermore, integrate the acquired knowledge into your phrasebook, and learn from conjugating infinitive verbs to the Eastern Arabic nuances for diction and grammar.

At the fulfilment of this course, you will have learnt vital phrases to take your Arabic wording skills to the test. This language has an extended glossary and a limitless list of expressions. If you pay any attention to Arabic poetry before even picking up the phonetics of the language, you may find the intonation unusual or even exotic. Arabic is a rich Semitic language with a diverse array of dialects that will highlight your resume, among others. The major obstacle is choosing which dialect to pursue. This course provides everything you need to get you started. Begin using ordinal numbers, ask questions about individuals or locations and practise telling the time in Arabic. Your interest in the language and your command of the Egyptian vernacular will make it easier to communicate with over 55 million Egyptians. The programme’s teaching approaches will enable you to acquire the skills and knowledge to converse with Arab natives. No-one is suggesting that learning Arabic will be simple. The difficulty, on the other hand, may refine your intellect. Proficiency in the Arabic language can result in many lifestyle changes, like pursuing a line of work as a language facilitator, speaker, business or foreign investor. The issue is not about whether mastering Arabic is worthwhile, but whether you are up for the challenge. This course will make you proficient in Arabic and confident in the language! So enrol today!
